comment: Later in life, Najdorf took up the King's Indian with formidable effect. His games at Zurich in 1953, along with those of Gligoric, made a profound impression on Bobby Fischer. Here, he sets up a classic Stonewall Dutch -- a variation that was serving the up-and-coming Russian player Mikhail Botvinnik well at about the same time.

comment: Truly a game of brutal efficiency. Black sacrificed all four minor pieces! Small wonder that this game was christened "The Polish Immortal".
